intro: Hoffmannseggia trifoliata var. pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed hoffmannseggia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its succulent stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three parts, though the varietal form pentaphylla has five leaflets. This variation in leaf structure contributes to its unique botanical identity and ecological niche.
